enigma.core
Class Enigma

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--enigma.core.Enigma
public class Enigma
extends Object

Provides general Enigma services, such wildcard expansion and Console creation.

Author:
Ethan Royael Nicholas (ethan@ethannicholas.com)
Status:
UNSTABLE. Incompatible changes may be introduced in the future, although they are not likely to be drastic.

Method Detail

getEnvironment

public static Environment getEnvironment()
Returns the Environment associated with the current application.

setEnvironment

public static void setEnvironment(Environment environment)
                           throws SecurityException
Sets the Environment associated with the current application. If there is a security manager, its checkPermission method is first called with a RuntimePermission("enigma.core.Enigma.setEnvironment") permission to see if it's okay to change the Environment.

Throws:
SecurityException - if the security manager denies the request

getConsole

public static Console getConsole()
Returns the Console associated with the current virtual machine. If a Console does not yet exist, one will be created, and the System.in, System.out, and System.err streams will be mapped to the new Console's InputStream and OutputStream. In a graphical environment, the Console will typically be displayed in a Frame.

Returns:
the Console associated with the current virtual machine, first creating one if necessary

createTextWindow

public static TextWindow createTextWindow(String title)
Creates a new TextWindow appropriate for the current environment.

Parameters:
title - the display title of the TextWindow

getConsole

public static Console getConsole(String title)
Returns the Console associated with the current virtual machine. If a Console does not yet exist, one will be created with the specified title, and the System.in, System.out, and System.err streams will be mapped to the new Console's InputStream and OutputStream. If a Console already exists for the current virtual machine, its title will be set to the specified title. In a graphical environment, the Console will typically be displayed in a Frame.

Parameters:
title - the preferred console title, or null to use the default
Returns:
the Console associated with the current virtual machine, first creating one if necessary

installConsole

public static void installConsole(Console console)
Installs the specified Console as the current virtual machine's default Console. This method is normally invoked automatically by getConsole(), and it should only be called manually when a non-default Console is desired. After calling installConsole, subsequent calls to getConsole() will return the newly-installed Console.

Parameters:
console - the Console to install
Throws:
SecurityException - if the security manager denies the request
See Also:
getConsole()

isFileSystemCaseSensitive

public static boolean isFileSystemCaseSensitive(File path)
Returns true if the filesystem on which the specified file lives is case-sensitive. Case-preserving but case-insensitive (as with Microsoft Windows) file systems return false; the only issue in question here is whether two filenames that differ only by case are considered to be the same file or two different files.

Parameters:
path - the file whose filesystem is being examined
Returns:
true if the specified file's filesystem is case-sensitive, false otherwise.

resolvePath

public static File resolvePath(String path)
Resolves the specified absolute or relative path against the Environment's current working directory to compute a full filename. If the path is absolute, the path itself is returned (as a File), otherwise the path is treated as relative to the current working directory. Use of this method is useful for proper pathname handling, as the presence of drive letter prefixes under Microsoft Windows can otherwise require special-casing.

Parameters:
path -
See Also:
Environment.getCurrentPath(), expandWildcards(java.lang.String)

expandWildcards

public static File[] expandWildcards(String path)
Expands a potentially-wildcard-containing path into an array of files. Ordinary Unix rules are followed, in that an asterisk ('*') matches zero or more characters, and a question mark ('?') matches any single character.

If the path is relative, it is resolved against the current working directory (see Environment.getCurrentPath()). If it is a simple file name (i.e. doesn't contain wildcard characters) which refers to an existing file, then a single-element array containing the specified file is returned. If the wildcard expression or simple file name does not match any existing files, a zero-element array is returned (never null).

Returns:
an array of Files referred to by the path expression
See Also:
Environment.getCurrentPath(), resolvePath(java.lang.String)

createVirtualMachine

public static VirtualMachine createVirtualMachine(VirtualMachineConfiguration cfg)
                                           throws VirtualMachineInstantiationException,
                                                  SecurityException
Creates a new virtual machine which will run in parallel to the current virtual machine.

Parameters:
cfg - a VirtualMachineConfiguration specifying the parameters of the new virtual machine
Returns:
a VirtualMachine object which allows you to interact with the newly-created virtual machine
Throws:
SecurityException - if the security manager's checkExec() method denies the request
VirtualMachineInstantiationException
Status:
EXPERIMENTAL. Drastic, incompatible changes may be introduced in the future. You have been warned.
